meanings.definition: The arrangement of leaves on a stem.
meanings.sent1: The phyllotaxes of the plant showed a spiral pattern of leaf arrangement.
meanings.sent2: The gardener observed the phyllotaxes of the tree to understand its growth pattern.
meanings.sent3: The phyllotaxes of the bush were so orderly, it looked like a leafy staircase.
meanings.sent4: In the dense forest, the phyllotaxes of the trees created a natural canopy above.
meanings.sent5: The intricate phyllotaxes of the vine made it a botanical marvel.

meanings.sent1: Botanists use phyllotaxes to understand how leaves grow on plants.
meanings.sent2: The university offers a course on phyllotaxes for students interested in plant biology.
meanings.sent3: During the phyllotaxes class, the students had fun arranging leaves in different patterns.
meanings.sent4: The research on phyllotaxes revealed fascinating insights into plant development.
meanings.sent5: The book on phyllotaxes provided a comprehensive guide to leaf organization.

meanings.definition: The pattern in which leaves are arranged on a stem.
meanings.sent1: The phyllotaxes of the rose bush displayed a beautiful rosette pattern.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the phyllotaxes of the crop plants and adjusted their spacing accordingly.
meanings.sent3: The phyllotaxes of the tree looked like a natural work of art.
meanings.sent4: The intricate phyllotaxes of the fern resembled a delicate lace pattern.
meanings.sent5: The phyllotaxes of the succulent plant formed a perfect spiral arrangement.
